    LoginHandler

    public class GwtProcessAppRootPanel<P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P>
    A standard root panel manager for applications with a main process.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • displayMessage

        public void displayMessage(java.lang.String sMessage,
                           int nDisplayTime)
        Displays a message in the message area. Using NULL as the message argument will clear any previous message. This default implementation forwards the call to the parent panel manager if such exists. If not this method will have no effect. It can either be overridden by a certain subclass or by a parent panel manager which then handles the message display.
        Overrides:
        displayMessage in class PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Parameters:
        sMessage - The message to display or NULL to clear the message
        nDisplayTime - The time in milliseconds to display the message or zero for no timeout

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes this panel manager. Subclasses can override this method if necessary to cleanup resource they have acquired. The superclass method should always be invoked.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>

      • updateUI

        public void updateUI()
        This method can be be overridden by subclasses to update the panel content from model data if it has changed. The default implementation invokes Component.repaint() on the manager's panel.

        Attention: Invoking this method will replace any values entered into input components with the model value stored in the data elements. Therefore it should only be invoked on display UIs or when the resetting of input fields is explicitly desired.

        Overrides:
        updateUI in class PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>

        Specified by:

      • createProcessPanel

        protected ProcessPanelManager createProcessPanel(de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Creates the process panel that will be used to render the application process. Can be overridden to return a different instance than the default implementation ProcessPanelManager.
        Parameters:
        rProcessState - The current process state
        Returns:
        A new process panel manager instance

      • displayProcess

        protected void displayProcess(de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        This method must be implemented by a panel manager in a panel manager hierarchy to display the result of a process execution. This method will be invoked by GwtApplicationPanelManager.executeProcess(String, DataElement). The default implementation invokes the parent method if a parent exists.
        Overrides:
        displayProcess in class GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Parameters:
        rProcessState - The process state returned by the process execution

      • getCloseWarning

        protected java.lang.String getCloseWarning()
        Overridden to check whether process panels are currently open.
        Overrides:
        getCloseWarning in class PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Returns:
        The close warning or NULL if the window can be closed without a warning
        See Also:
        PanelManager.getCloseWarning()

      • getProcessContainer

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Container getProcessContainer()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to return the container in which the result of a process execution will be displayed. This will be used by the method GwtApplicationPanelManager.setClientSize(ProcessDescription) to calculate the correct size of the client area. If not overridden the container of this panel will be returned.
        Overrides:
        getProcessContainer in class GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Returns:
        The process container

      • getUserData

        protected de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList getUserData()
        Returns the client-specific data for the currently authenticated user. This call is forwarded to the parent manager so that it must be implemented by the root panel manager.
        Overrides:
        getUserData in class GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Returns:
        The user data or NULL if no user has been authenticated

      • logout

        protected void logout()
        Description copied from class: GwtApplicationPanelManager
        Performs a logout of the current user. This call is forwarded to the parent manager so that it must be implemented by the root panel manager.
        Overrides:
        logout in class GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        See Also:
        CustomerSelfCarePanelManager#logout()

        Parameters:
        bReauthenticate - TRUE if this is a re-authentication because of an expired session

        AuthenticationPanelManager.performLogin(boolean)

      • processFinished

        protected void processFinished(PanelManager<?,?> rPanelManager,
                               de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Will be invoked by the ProcessPanelManager after a process has finished execution. The standard implementation simply invokes the parent panel manger's method if a parent is available. The handling is typically implemented in the root of the panel hierarchy.
        Overrides:
        processFinished in class GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Parameters:
        rPanelManager - The manager of the causing panel
        rProcessState - The last state of the finished process

      • processUpdated

        protected void processUpdated(PanelManager<?,?> rPanelManager,
                              de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Will be invoked by the ProcessPanelManager after a process has updated it's state, typically when it stops for an interaction. The standard implementation simply invokes the parent panel manger's method if a parent is available. The handling is typically implemented in the root of the panel hierarchy.
        Overrides:
        processUpdated in class GwtApplicationPanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Parameters:
        rPanelManager - The manager of the causing panel
        rProcessState - The current process state

      • removeApplicationPanel

        protected void removeApplicationPanel()
        Must be implemented to remove the main panel of an application. This method can be invoked to reset the application's view. This happens typically if a user's authentication has expired.

        The default implementation invokes the parent method if a parent panel manager is set. Therefore the implementation of this method should be done in the root panel manager of the application.

        Overrides:
        removeApplicationPanel in class PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
